title: Genuinely Confused
body:
Removing everything magical about the Cottontail Teemo splash for a cheap knockoff was bad. Giving Sakura and Sun Goddess Karma the weeaboo treatment was also pretty bad. Giving Renegade Talon the face of a corpse while simultaneously toning down Karthus's corpse-face was definitely tragic.

But Musketeer Twisted Fate?
Really?
From this; 
http://www.leagueoflegendsskins.com/images/champions/splash/TwistedFate_6.jpg

to this?
http://livedoor.blogimg.jp/lollll/imgs/e/e/ee8d576c.jpg

For the other skins, they weren't exactly upgrades stylistically but I can see how somebody on the less artistic side may have seen the higher definition of the new splashes and thought; "Yeah, those are better." 
But this? Going from a dynamic, well-composed piece of decent quality to that?
Going from a piece that tells a story to a piece that you could easily swap out for any cheap mobile game?

If I'm being completely honest, one of my favourite parts about League has been the splash arts. I save my favourites on my computer and set them as my backgrounds, and I've always appreciated the quality and artistry that seemingly went into all of them, even excusing the occasional anatomical anomaly. 

But I'm sorry, I don't understand nor can I support the decisions that somebody with functioning eyeballs must be making. I just can't comprehend them. For now the splash card for Musketeer TF seems to be the original, but the one that shows up on the client under TF is the other one and that worries me. 

There's enough complaints about _at least_ the Cottontail Teemo splash to warrant a change, I'd think; Riot did as much for the Fiora splash. (Granted, that was slightly more drastic of a change, but still just as offensive)

I don't usually input on things like this but I just can't fathom anybody supporting these changes.

replies.body:
Good Lord...
That skin immediately reminded of those annoying ads for obviously cheap flash games trying way too hard to look cool.

> [{quoted}](name=2WhiteAndNerdy,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=UEyG8xLq,comment-id=0002,timestamp=2016-04-24T01:22:47.330+0000)
>
> Good Lord...
> That skin immediately reminded of those annoying ads for obviously cheap flash games trying way too hard to look cool.

Yeah it looks like the background for one of those billions of free to play card games on your phone with the text on the side.

Not exactly "good spash art" material. I mean the champion isn't even centered in the picture and just random empty space there as if it wasn't even created to be a splash, but an advertisement for something.

> [{quoted}](name=Xonra,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=UEyG8xLq,comment-id=00020000,timestamp=2016-04-24T07:16:01.683+0000)
>
> Yeah it looks like the background for one of those billions of free to play card games on your phone with the text on the side.
> 
> Not exactly "good spash art" material. I mean the champion isn't even centered in the picture and just random empty space there as if it wasn't even created to be a splash, but an advertisement for something.

Champions are never centered they're always to the right. How tf have you not noticed that? It's so that text overlays on the left don't cover the character
As well as it being bad composition, there's nothing more uninteresting than a perfectly centered character. Most visual composition follow the rule of thirds to make it look better.
It tends to happen when an artist tries to compensate for their inability to draw a good pose by adding excessive glowy special effects.
It looks like garbage art you would find on an ad for a shitty browser game or something...
That moment when you realize that League has those kinds of adds...
Not really, they're actually really good ads, the Yasuo one comes to mind.
A musketeer is a swashbuckling hero. Nothing in this new splash says that. In fact it screams weird Illuminati mage, and its horrendous.

> [{quoted}](name=JerulEon,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=UEyG8xLq,comment-id=0006,timestamp=2016-04-24T03:43:57.158+0000)
>
> A musketeer is a swashbuckling hero. Nothing in this new splash says that. In fact it screams weird Illuminati mage, and its horrendous.

Actually Musketeer's used early rifles.... it's more myth than fact about the sword thing. They did have daggers/short swords if either ran out of shot or enemies got too close. If they ever used swords it was more a parade thing than actual combat.

> [{quoted}](name=Hatless Casual,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=UEyG8xLq,comment-id=00060000,timestamp=2016-04-24T04:55:58.217+0000)
>
> Actually Musketeer's used early rifles.... it's more myth than fact about the sword thing. They did have daggers/short swords if either ran out of shot or enemies got too close. If they ever used swords it was more a parade thing than actual combat.

Lmao, that's ironic because the 3 Musketeers are usually depicted with 3 swords crossed or fighting with their sabers. I guess everyone assumes it.

The new splash is still bad xd
Plot twist: Musketeers used Muskets
yeah it's kind of in the name for a reason
his argument still stands there nothing that display a musketeer theme
Trading in his cards for swords, OP.

*they're glowing cards all lined up, just saiyan*

I agree that the second art is pretty awful though.

I don't understand either. I can't even make ANY logical sense for why they choose that... crappy Chinese splash art.

Who chooses these kinds of shit? I love Riot, and am not some Riot hater, but seriously? Not only did Riot remove the cute and cuddly Cottaintail Teemo splashart that I love, Riot did this as well. It's really irritating.

> [{quoted}](name=Choo6,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=UEyG8xLq,comment-id=0003,timestamp=2016-04-24T01:47:00.301+0000)
>
> I don't understand either. I can't even make ANY logical sense for why they choose that... crappy Chinese splash art.
> 
> Who chooses these kinds of shit? I love Riot, and am not some Riot hater, but seriously? Not only did Riot remove the cute and cuddly Cottaintail Teemo splashart that I love, Riot did this as well. It's really irritating.

Sadly there was no "choosing". Tencent TOLD them to make all the splashed across regions as one, and they (Tencent) "Chose" the Chinese splash art. I mean, no bias or anything I'm sure.

The joys of Riot being owned by a Chinese company. That and extra levels of censorship in countries that don't share the censorship views of China.

I heard Tencent owned LoL since 2011, but I never seen Tencent affecting the game until now. If it's true, if Tencent forced Riot games to sell themselves out, I won't be as surprised if LoL would start to lose popularity in the future similar to WoW.

> [{quoted}](name=Choo6,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=UEyG8xLq,comment-id=000300010000,timestamp=2016-04-24T07:41:03.686+0000)
>
> I heard Tencent owned LoL since 2011, but I never seen Tencent affecting the game until now. If it's true, if Tencent forced Riot games to sell themselves out, I won't be as surprised if LoL would start to lose popularity in the future similar to WoW.

I am making the decision to break away from the game. After all of this... I would just rather leave the game behind rather than to keep playing it and continue to complain about every disgusting decision they keep making. The "updates", the "balances", the "splash arts" the contradictions. League of Legends has reached its peak, now its at the time in its life where it has nowhere else to go but down. 

If this is where the game is going, then i think it may be time for me to move on. Reluctantly, but necessarily.

> [{quoted}](name=Choo6,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=UEyG8xLq,comment-id=0003,timestamp=2016-04-24T01:47:00.301+0000)
>
> I don't understand either. I can't even make ANY logical sense for why they choose that... crappy Chinese splash art.
> 
> Who chooses these kinds of shit? I love Riot, and am not some Riot hater, but seriously? Not only did Riot remove the cute and cuddly Cottaintail Teemo splashart that I love, Riot did this as well. It's really irritating.

Dont you remember the whole Riot company was bought by some chinese company?

Maybe they want to see more of the face, or they like the overly bright effects?

Those would be my two guesses, but I still think they made the wrong decision.

I just scrolled down and saw the picture... and thought that you were posting something about how a mobile game had cheaply copied TF. Then I actually read the post and realized... THAT WAS THE NEW SPLASHART. 
{{sticker:zombie-nunu-bummed}}

If you stuck a, "League of Angels" mark up in the corner I'd legit think they made it themselves for once in their life.

That's how bad this is. I'm so glad I don't use this skin, because I'd never use it with this for a splash.
I'll be honest, they should have gotten our musketeer TF splash, it feels a lot more like a "musketeer" than the one we have now. that one feels more like "magician TF 2".

Chinese casual market.

Less update times for them means more people playing. We get to suffer so they don't have to because of sheer population numbers.

They won't tell you that, but it's the case.

Welcome to the new Riot under Tencent games, where profit is the only thing that will ever matter to them no matter the damage they do. EA makes better goddamn marketing - no, _Konami_ makes better marketing decisions than they do. (If you're not aware of what I'm speaking of: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Silent_Hills and http://www.polygon.com/2016/2/18/11035002/hideo-kojima-interview-2016 )

Lol riot is NOWHERE NEAR as bad as EA or konami.

You realize every single one of these splashs are going to be replaced again right?

With actual updated ones.

They just replaced every splash with the Chinese one for uniformity for now.

And I mean cmon even if they replace every splash with a picture of lyte flipping you off it shouldn't matter. It's a piece of art you see for 15 seconds and has no bearing on the game what so ever.
Dynamic Queue.

And? I enjoy dynamic que and I play solo only.

I mean how dare they allow people to play with freinds... that definatly puts them on the same leauge as releasing unfinished games and still having the audacity to remove even more content and sell it as DLC

No. Not the fact that Dynamic Queue was released. It's the fact that _only_ Dynamic Queue is an option.

Since you're missing the entire point, let's spell it out: Riot doesn't give a shit. They stopped listening to their long-time, primary audience for a new audience that by sheer volume could drown out even the oldest and largest fanbases in _any_ game, movie, media entity, anywhere. But here's the thing: it's probably not even _right_. The Chinese market probably honestly would prefer our splashes to theirs, but because their audience is bigger, their servers are more taxed, it'd be just a modicum more of a hassle to actually even out the splashes and just put in the best - the best on either side, a little update to us a little update to them. But no, no no no. We can't have even the _smallest_ delay to the other side because that would mean lost money - lost thousands. Oh yeah, thousands. That's the funny thing - it wouldn't even be a massive financial hit. At most it's a slight inconvenience for actual _quality control_. Oh, be still my heart.

And please, spare me the "But but Riot said this" crap. Riot said they did this to due to standards in other countries limiting and complicating splash-art releases. Riot said they were picking the "most artistically and thematically fitting splashes". Do you _really_ buy that? Really? You buy that? You're actually going to look at this whole process and tell me they honestly did just that?

First day of the update, _multiple_ splash-arts were reverted to fucking censor them. All Chinese. _Multiple_ splash-arts have been altered even on the PBE because they need to be censored. Do _not_ give me that bullshit, and don't even begin to try and justify this fucking splash-art change as the most thematically fitting splash - fuck you. No, seriously, fuck you.

The end point is Riot is **lying**. **To our faces**. They stopped caring about their community. They stopped listening. They just bulldoze their way forward. The fact that solo-queue got axed while they piss on our feet about it for months on end, these constant and borderline asinine changes that only worsen things, the utter lack of any **_meaningful_** feedback from Riot on _any_ of these issues - they're following the exact practices that other companies fall into, and they aren't fucking budging because money. That is the exact practice of those other companies - granted Konami's an outlier in that there is nobody in the universe who can fathom their logic as it is purely self-destructive and is utterly batshit, but the point still stands. Ultimately it's not what the fans or the players or what anybody else wants, it's just profit. And profit-hunting has ruined so many fucking great things that it's insulting to be forced to watch it in action like this while literally explaining that it's only destructive.

You do realize they will eventually update our splash with high quality ones right?

Also if you have 1 item that has to be the same in multiple countries you ALWAYS go with the most restrictive countries rules hence the censoring.

And saying they lied about solo q is harsh and exactly the reason they don't give feedback they would of been better of never saying a single thing about solo q. Which is quite shitty considering they get bitched at if they communicate and botched at if they don't it's a literal lose lose besides  you have no proof that they never intended to release it at all.

Maybe they were going to release solo q only to notice it didn't play nice as all with dynamic que. I mean people changing their mind based on new information...who would of thought.

Also they stopped giving feedback due to how incredibly toxic their community is. They NEVER give release dates anymore because they get crucified if they miss it by one day.

I mean what do you expect them to say about solo q "lol fuck solp q players we hate them"? They have already said EXACTLY why their is no solo q yet. That they can't figure out how to get it to play nice with dynamic que. I mean Jesus how much more feedback do you want they gave all the info you could ever want already.
Funny thing is Musketeer TF is one of the better splashes in League right now, and it's only 750 RP.

I wish Riot at least acknowledged the  concerns regarding the splash changes for the Cottontail Teemo, Sun Goddess Karma, Goth Annie and this TF skin as well.

All of these skins have had threads dedicated to the complaints against not replacing the original splashes in the top read threads for quite a few days - though nothing has been said by Riot about it.  I really do hope these changes get reverted much like the Nightraven Fiora skin. I absolutely adored the Cottontail Teemo splash due to how cute and charming it was; however, the "new" splash depicts Teemo with an extremely disfigured face that hardly bears a resemblance to him, but rather that of an old man.

It's a shame - I hope Riot responds about this. I know this is a temporary fix, but there's so many splashes out there for Riot to work on and who knows how long it will take to get to these specific splashes.

That's what bothers me the most about this whole thing. While I don't understand how anybody could think these are improvements, the fact that Riot doesn't even seem to be acknowledging the outcry is even worse. 
Especially in comparison to the Fiora incident.
You do realize that these changes are temporary, right...?
Or... you know making Gothic Annie from a brooding child that looks like she'll flash tibbers you to a happy child that... idek- it completely ruined the whole gothic appeal of the skin.
Yeah this is like one of those things where Riot just went full retard.
Riot went really stupid with the splash art changes. Cottontail Teemo is like what the actual fuck??

That change is nearly as bad as what old Pax Sivir to Chinese Pax Sivir was:

https://i.ytimg.com/vi/ejEiTeT-aTw/hqdefault.jpg

to

http://st.elohell.net/public/chill/4241d7604b330063b2e16d0948fbcaca.jpg





I think both of these need to be reverted. The old splash arts actually have the same art style as current splash arts, these shuffles definitely do not, they look cheap, chinese knock-off, bad.

Art is subjective, so to be fair, the only real objective way one can compare the quality of splash arts is through technical accuracy and mastery. Therefore, your claim that people on the "less artistic side" will judge technically superior splashes to be better is complete bullshit. I will guarantee you, no one with years or even a lifetime of extensive art training and practice(as you would say, people on the "less artistc side") will not be able to catch the glaring errors and mistakes in the old splashes, nor will they be unable to appreciate a superior execution of mechanics.

Dynamic poses beats symmetry...

Seriously.
have you seen the new toxic mundo splash art? it looks like a 2nd grader drew it...badly...
Well, China has been on a rampage trying to purge american tech companies. I think Riot is having to bend knee to keep on Tencent's good side or they get ousted, too.

All these whiny splash art threads... RIOT IS CHANGING THEM ALL PERMANENTLY. Just get over it and wait like good children for the new ones! Trust me, I KNOW these splash arts are an eyesore and Sungoddess Karma is... horrific... but there's no point in complaining! Riot isn't going to single out the worst offenders of splash art and say, "Oh... you're right NA! Your original splash was better! Guess our goal of ~globalizing skins will be put aside for... um... Musketeer Twisted Fate because YOU don't like it as much!"

Just accept that you're going to have to wait for these splash arts to be updated. There are literally hundreds. You will just have to wait. It sucks, but it's the truth, and no amount of sad board threads will change that.

> I'm sorry, I don't understand nor can I support the decisions that somebody with functioning eyeballs must be making.


Hahahah best thing I've read all day! Quality!
I swear, I'm getting real tired of these threads.

My biggest problem with the 'new' splashes is that they don't LOOK like Riot splasharts. They look like FANART, but because they're high resolution, shinier and 'better', people are just accepting them.

I'd rather keep a lot of the older arts for longer than to have to stare at the random-looking pieces of crap. 
The 'new' arts are supposed to be placeholders because actual updated art is supposed to 'be on the way; soon'. I'd really rather just wait.

Yeah, this is my main problem. All these anime pictures are shiny and HD and all, but they don't look like that distinct art style we love. They look cheap; art like that is dime a dozen. 
If they're going to put higher quality splashes in later, why downgrade the quality so heavily first? I don't get it.

Didn't read all of the comments, but I was looking over the new splashes for champs... I mean "new" and I noticed that A LOT of these "new" splashes I saw from the Chinese version yeaaaaaars ago.
For example, Eve's splashes. Where she looks even more like a Satanic Stripper than the original splashes had. And no, I'm not talking about her classic. I mean Masquerade Evelynn and Shadow Evelynn.
Annie is.. Her splashes now are ridiculous. Goth Annie for example. I loved the original before this replacement. Red Riding Annie was changed a while back but still, she's too... Cutesy. Annie in Wonderland, another example. Annie isn't what she used to be to me and I'm pretty sure a lot of other people. Also Frostfire Annie is a joke.
Sivir's "new" splashes are a weeaboo's wet dream.
A LOT of these "new" splash arts are seriously questionable and I don't really approve or like many of them... I don't understand the point behind changing a lot of these.  I don't support them at all.
